page.title: 11FARMING IN BLOFIELD
page.content: Most farms in the Blofield area are of at least 70 acres and concentrate on growing wheat, barley and sugar beet. Other crops include potatoes, peas and grass. Most farms also keep some livestock up to 100 animals either pigs or cattle, and sometimes goats. The pigs are kept in special pighouses and the cattle graze in the fields. The farms have several tractors as well as other machinery, such as combine harvesters, balers for hay or straw, sugar beet lifters and sprayers. The farmers use much machinery, so do not employ many farm labourers. The soils are rich and the farmers get good yields of crops by using fertilizers and sprays to kill weeds and pests.
